title: Which fitness watch is a better buy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most fitness watch nowadays comes with built-in navigation sensors include three-axis compass, gyroscope and barometric altimeter as well as multiple satellite system. Wearing these accessories is one of the high-performance way to beat yesterday and bring your maps and music along. Here’s some examples of cool fitness watches: Garmin Fenix 5 Plus  If you go off the grid at all, whether it's for hiking, backpacking, or skiing, you probably need a Garmin GPS watch. The Fenix 5 Plus hits every single sweet spot. You want in-color, detailed topographical maps? How about contactless payments, or storage for up to 500 sounds? Do you want granular data on step counts and your heart rate? Do you want to find your phone? And finally, do you want all of this wrapped up in a exceptionally durable, waterproof package that's small enough to fit on the tiniest of wrists? If you can stomach the price, the Fenix 5 Plus has it all.  Xiaomi Mi Band  Real-time Display of Exercise Duration, Mileage, Heart Rate, etc. , 50 meters Swimming Waterproof. department_name:unisex-adultAll-Day Health Management More accurate pedometer, heart rate, sleep quality monitoring, sedentary reminderReject Call without Phone The brand new millet bracelet 3 can also display the caller name or number if you do not want to answer, long press can reject the call.New Xiaomi Sports APP In Xiaomi Sports App, you can set daily needs according to your own situation. Choose the fitness program that suits you and regularly check your week’s exercise Sleep data, etc.Daily pedometerMicrofiber Withings Steel HR Sport  Withings recently reacquired its brand from Nokia, and released new fitness trackers that offer its signature blend of simplicity, affordability, and good looks. The Move is its most affordable watch. We were also impressed by the Move ECG at CES, which can take an electrocardiogram at any time. The Steel HR is still fantastic. It can get phone notifications, check your heart rate, and record one of almost 40 activities with connected GPS. It still connects to Nokia's simple, easy to use Health Mate app so it can check your sleep or assess your fitness level by estimating your maximum oxygen intake. However, the tiny digital screen is a little hard to read in sunlight, and manipulating it with the single side button is annoying. p/s: for more tools to boost your health and productivity
